content:
Agree with kayou, this clash shouldn't be in Reverse mode.

I just got it in a clash and managed to get 100% on test cases, but then got 33% on the actual validators because NONE of the test cases test the difference between rounding the answer and truncating it. Whereas FOUR validators do...

Reverse mode clashes need to have very well-defined test cases if you want people to reverse engineer the problem... ended up losing to a bot who got 100%, but all the humans and one other bot got 33% or 0% in the end.

I suggest swapping 'multiple grade' with 'Validator 3' and 'Final test' with 'Validator 6'. Also I just don't think this is simple enough for reverse mode, as kayou says.
It took me 12 minutes to solve. The main problem is that subjects can have multiple separate marks and it's not evident that the weight shouldn't be applied to each assessment, but rather you need to first average the marks for the subject and THEN apply the weight and THEN take the average of all subjects. It's a lot to ask for reverse mode.

This clash shouldn't have been approved as it:
Did someone really test it in reverse mode (without reading the statement) and finish in less than 5 minutes ?
In a clash for 8 people I won with 83% in 11 minutes and iI was first . 1 player did 33% all the others 0%
It was 100% during the test, after checking here it failled for validator 4 but not test 4


The shortest mode for this clash would be better than Reverse.

Typo in the goal, "aways" should be "always".
Otherwise, looks fun!!

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: concrete problems and a bit tricky i like it

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It can be tricky if you rush the solution. I had to think for a few minutes while coding my own solution.

It may be worthwhile to note that if a subject has multiple grades, then the average grade of that subject (with the respective weight) will be used to calculate the total average grade.
I like the use of fractions along with percentages.

Some typos:
- 'You most' --> 'You must'
- 'a list of grade' --> 'a list of grades'

Suggestion to rephrase:
- 'and then a list of grade with a subject. --> 'and then a list of grades (notated as percentage or fraction) for those subjects. There can be multiple grades for the same subject.'

Your contribution has been uploaded twice. Please remove one of them. The other link is:
https://www.codingame.com/contribute/view/72583a3919820c3de8d711ea5cbf8c89aaddc

All sections
* "Coefficient" doesn't seem to be the correct word… Maybe "weighting"?

Input section
* Please mention that [[coefficient]] (probably renamed as [[weighting]]) is an integer.

* Please change "mark" to "marks".

* Please change "two int" to "two integers".

* Please change "an int" to "an integer".

* Please format "/" and "%" as {{constants}} and remove the quotation marks.

Thanks.

Thank you for you comment :)
I change coefficient with the word weight as it's the same they use on this website:
https://gradecalculator.mes.fm/weighted-average-calculator
Thank you for your comment, I made every change ^^
Thank you that's a good catch, I added one line to make that point more clear
Sorry about it, I just removed the reverse mode. I think fastest is enough anyway

Sorry about it, I just removed the reverse mode. I think fastest is enough anyway.
I did the swap for  'multiple grade' and 'Validator 3' but I think "Validator 6" is kind of too big to be switch with "Final test"
Thank you for your time
Fair enough, thanks for implementing the majority of the suggestions. It should be quite fine now. :)
By the way, I saw that we had taken a totally different approach to the problem. if you are interested in my solution ?
